sentences.english: Or for love in the heart can not calm the Brief Encounter and settle old scores?
sentences.chinese: 还是为爱在心里不能坦然的相见恨晚而心有不甘？

sentences.english: She gave ingenuous answers to the strangers' entire question.
sentences.chinese: 她心底坦然回答了这位陌生人的全部询问。

sentences.english: Have so an inn, counterjumper very calm ground accost I come in sit.
sentences.chinese: 有这么一家店，店员很坦然地招呼我进来坐。

sentences.english: Everyone will be groomed and polished and comfortable with the cameras.
sentences.chinese: 大家将会修饰打扮一番，并且在镜头之前坦然自若。

sentences.english: Dutch coach Bert Van Marwijk was gracious in defeat.

sentences.english: She smiled broadly at Lini's stare .
sentences.chinese: 当林妮望着她时，她坦然一笑。

sentences.english: I would be also very calm, the business origin of affection permit can not the half be some force.
sentences.chinese: 我也会很坦然，感情的事本就容不得半些勉强。

sentences.english: Hui hai regret wrong letter, acting calm to take all the treasures.
sentences.chinese: 汇海后悔错信力行，力行坦然要取走夹万内的宝物。

sentences.english: Although facing great pressure from cheap beasts, I feel it just another day.
sentences.chinese: 即使面对贱狗们越来越大的压力，我只是坦然而已。

sentences.english: Laughing off misunderstandings and animosities is a kind of frankness and tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 应对误解和仇恨一笑而过，是一种坦然宽容。

sentences.english: Laugh at life, calm and doing things to make life into a very high level.

sentences.english: Facing my camera, some kis curious, some peaceful.

sentences.english: Under the circumstances I would find it impossible to hold my head up in the town.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的情况下我不可能在镇上表现得坦然自若。

sentences.english: Take kindly the counsel of the years, gracefully surrendering the things of youth.
sentences.chinese: 善待岁月给你的忠告，坦然放下年少的不更事。

sentences.english: We need to accept these problems as we are in the samsaric world which is full of suffering.
sentences.chinese: 在这轮回里，我们必须坦然的接收这些苦难。

sentences.english: Does he look nervous or comfortable?
sentences.chinese: 他看上去是紧张还是坦然？

definition: cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
